intro: Germainia capitata, commonly known as the mountain germander, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Germainia capitata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
